text:
Q: Swift keyboard extension opens a URL when Full Access is not allowed on iOS 26.0 and later A:

According to Apple’s documentation, keyboard extensions without Full Access are heavily sandboxed and have limited interaction with the system and other apps.

Opening URLs or launching the host app requires Open Access (Full Access) to be enabled.

If another keyboard appears to do this without Full Access, it cannot be verified without access to its source code.

Such behavior would likely rely on a different user-driven flow or private/undocumented APIs, which are not supported or guaranteed by Apple.

Q: Guidewire Studio CC 10.2.4 P2 - Gosu Plugin problems - NoSuchFieldError / IndicatorCancellationException on Apple Silicon (M1) - IntelliJ 2024.1 A:

PROBLEM SOLVED:

  • Downloaded the OOTB GW CC from https://community.guidewire.com/s/resources#

  • I downloaded the version 10.2.4

  • Deleted the studio/ folder existing in my project

  • Copied from the freshly downloaded claimcenter the studio/ folder

  • Pasted into my project

  • Closed all IDEs

  • ./gwb cleanIdea

  • ./gwb idea

  • ./gwb clean build

  • Waited for some tests to run

  • export IDEA_HOME=/Application/[intelliJC-2024.1.5]/Contents

  • ./gwb stuio

    Done! I saw again the CC icon and gw studio ran perfectly.

Q: How to rename many files with a ID_suffix name to prefix_ID? A:

If the format is uniform, you can take the unique ID from each name and rebuild the filename:

for file in *_test_file.sas7bdat; do

    id=${file%%_*}
    mv $file test_file_${id}.sas7bdat

done

Q: Pycharm doesn't do syntax highlighting for regex when using the regex module instead of re A:

The JetBrains Rider IDE has a code attribute which controls this. Since PyCharm shares a lot of the code base of Rider, it’s possible that a similar way exists of annotating the Python code so that the IDE highlights the string correctly, although I haven’t found any documentation showing how to do this (if at all).
